page.title: 13Recreation in Newburgh
page.content: The Leeds-Liverpool Canal which lies near to Newburgh is used mainly for pleasure craft and country walks, and there is also a sports field, the King George V Memorial Field, donated after the Second World War. Newburgh won the Best Kept Village competition in 1984 and the Red Lion won a certificate for the best public house. The primary school won certificates for a Flora and Fauna competition. All these would show how the residents care for the appearance of their village. Newburgh has an annual fair in Summer, sponsored by a local club, and at Christmas a fir tree is placed on the village green and decked with lights. The green is used for church gatherings on special occasions. The centre of the village has been designated a conservation area.
